text: A Description of Those Who May Dwell with Yahweh
A psalm of David.\f + \fr Ps 15 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm \f*
O Yahweh, who may reside in your tent?
Who may dwell on your holy mountain?
He who walks blamelessly and does what is right.
He who speaks honestly in his heart.
He does not slander with his tongue.
He does not harm his friend,
nor ⸤bring up⸥\f + \fr 15:3 \ft Literally “lift up” \f* a disgrace against his neighbor.
In his eyes a rejected one \add is\add* contemptible,
but he honors those who respect Yahweh.
He takes an oath to \add his own\add* injury and does not retract it.
He does not lend his money at interest,
and does not take a bribe against \add the\add* innocent.
